tool_description: Welcome to SendGrid’s Web API v3! This API is RESTful, fully featured, and easy to integrate with.
name: SendGrid
title: SendGrid

api_list.name: Send
api_list.description: This endpoint allows you to send email over SendGrid’s v3 Web API,
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://rapidprod-sendgrid-v1.p.rapidapi.com/mail/send"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "rapidprod-sendgrid-v1.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.post(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

url = "https://rapidprod-sendgrid-v1.p.rapidapi.com/mail/send"

headers = {

print(response.json())

api_list.name: Create a batch ID
api_list.description: This endpoint allows you to generate a new batch ID. This batch ID can be associated with scheduled sends via the mail/send endpoint.  If you set the SMTPAPI header batch_id, it allows you to then associate multiple scheduled mail/send requests together with the same ID. Then at anytime up to 10 minutes before the schedule date, you can cancel all of the mail/send requests that have this batch ID by calling the Cancel Scheduled Send endpoint.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://rapidprod-sendgrid-v1.p.rapidapi.com/mail/batch"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "rapidprod-sendgrid-v1.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.post(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: Cancel or pause a scheduled send
api_list.description: This endpoint allows you to cancel or pause an email that has been scheduled to be sent.  If the maximum number of cancellations/pauses are added, HTTP 400 will be returned.  The Cancel Scheduled Sends feature allows the customer to cancel a scheduled send based on a Batch ID included in the SMTPAPI header. Scheduled sends cancelled less than 10 minutes before the scheduled time are not guaranteed to be cancelled.  For more information on Scheduled Sends, visit https://sendgrid.com/docs/Classroom/Send/When_Emails_Are_Sent/can_i_stop_a_scheduled_send.html
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://rapidprod-sendgrid-v1.p.rapidapi.com/user/scheduled_sends"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "rapidprod-sendgrid-v1.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.post(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: Create a new suppression group
api_list.description: This endpoint allows you to create a new suppression group.  Suppression groups, or unsubscribe groups, are specific types or categories of email that you would like your recipients to be able to unsubscribe from. For example: Daily Newsletters, Invoices, System Alerts.  The name and description of the unsubscribe group will be visible by recipients when they are managing their subscriptions.  Each user can create up to 25 different suppression groups.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://rapidprod-sendgrid-v1.p.rapidapi.com/asm/groups"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "rapidprod-sendgrid-v1.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.post(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: Add suppressions to a suppression group
api_list.description: This endpoint allows you to add email addresses to an unsubscribe group.  If you attempt to add suppressions to a group that has been deleted or does not exist, the suppressions will be added to the global suppressions list.  Suppressions are recipient email addresses that are added to unsubscribe groups. Once a recipient's address is on the suppressions list for an unsubscribe group, they will not receive any emails that are tagged with that unsubscribe group.

utterances.utterance: Add these email addresses to the suppression group with ID 12345 to stop sending them marketing emails.

Add these email addresses to the suppression group with ID seasonal_campaigns.
Please add these contacts to the suppression list for the group with ID event_invites.
Add these recipients to the unsubscribe group with group ID weekly_newsletter.

api_list.name: Search for suppressions within a group
api_list.description: This endpoint allows you to search a suppression group for multiple suppressions.  When given a list of email addresses and a group ID, this endpoint will return only the email addresses that have been unsubscribed from the given group.  Suppressions are a list of email addresses that will not receive content sent under a given group.

parameters.name: group_id
parameters.description: The ID of the suppression group that you would like to search.

utterances.utterance: Can you check which emails are unsubscribed in the suppression group with ID 12345?

Find all unsubscribed emails from the suppression group ID 98765.

Get the unsubscribed emails for the suppression group ID 55555.
Please search the suppression group with ID testgroup for suppressed emails.
List all emails that are suppressed in the group with ID 42abc.
Check the suppression group ID 2023emails for unsubscribed addresses.
Find suppressed contacts in the group with ID promo_group.

api_list.name: Create a parse setting
api_list.description: This endpoint allows you to create a new inbound parse setting.  The inbound parse webhook allows you to have incoming emails parsed, extracting some or all of the content, and then have that content POSTed by SendGrid to a URL of your choosing.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://rapidprod-sendgrid-v1.p.rapidapi.com/user/webhooks/parse/settings"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "rapidprod-sendgrid-v1.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.post(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
api_list.convert_code:
